intro: Funastrum lineare, commonly known as the linear funastrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
